answers.answer: Would do an FNA biopsy first.  Also, depending on how severe the hypothyroidism was before starting synthroid (ie was the TSH high, >10) - the lump may decrease in size with synthroid treatment.  If it is not bothering you and the FNA biopsy is benign, would usually  see if it shrinks with synthroid before committing to surgery.

question: Hello!I am a 43 year old female, recent blood work showed abnormal TSH levels and my doctor put me on synthroid. An ultrasound confirmed the presence of a large almost perfectly circular mass on the right side of my thyroid. My initial doctor visit was due to extreme fatigue, which I had initially thought was related to Type 1 diabetes. Mass is visable. Is surgery the only option?
title: Large mass on thyroid
